list_definition.definition: a powerful light at or on the front of a car, lorry/truck, train, ship, aeroplane/airplane etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: As it was getting dark, the driver switched on his headlights.

list_ex_of_english: I think the difference is that in one case the headlight is dipped, and in the other case it is dimmed.
There is a lot of difference between whether one dips a headlight or does not dip it.
Stock appearing grill and headlight openings must be retained.
Headlight glare is very rarely a factor in motorway accidents.
I am told that so small an error as one degree in the headlight beam can cause dazzle.
A lighted lamp shows at a considerably greater distance than a reflector, particularly when no headlight is shining on the reflector.
I am not aware of any headlight which provides an adequate driving light without some degree of dazzle.
Whereas previously one could have bought a bulb, one now has to buy a sealed headlight and the cost is far higher.
